title: 103_hr3060
content: The Act may be cited as the "Electronic Funds Transfer Federal Salary Act" and aims to ensure safe, economical, and effective payroll administration. The "Electronic Funds Transfer Federal Salary Act" amends Section 3332 of title 31, United States Code, defining financial organizations and authorizing the Secretary of the Treasury to require electronic transfers for employee pay. The Secretary may require funds transfer for employee pay if deemed practical and safeguards are in place. Regulations must designate a financial organization for payment receipt and require certification by agency heads. The Secretary may require employee pay to be transferred through a designated financial organization, with no transfer fees allowed. Employees can request exemptions from this process. Employees earning less than $20,000 annually can be exempt from certain requirements. National security provisions exempt certain agencies and employees. The CIA Director can authorize exemptions for the agency and its employees. The Director or designee can exempt employees from regulations if it risks intelligence disclosure. Financial organizations accepting payments from the US are fully acquitted. Other payments can be made via electronic fund transfers. The Secretary can authorize payments in various ways upon request. Section 3332 of title 31, United States Code, is amended for technical adjustments.
